Program_Title: Rep Doug Lamborn RCO Speaks in Favor of the No Taxpayer Funding for Abortion Act-A1-JId2NPec.mp4

Headlines: Rep. Doug Lamborn (R-CO) speaks powerfully of the generation lost to abortion and the discrimination against the unborn. Lamborn speaks in favor of prohibiting all taxpayer funding of abortion. Lamborn serves as a pro-life leader through his involvement in the Values Action Team and the House Pro-Life Caucus.

Text: and mr speaker i appreciate the leadership of my friend and colleague
representative chris smith of new jersey he is such a leader in this vital area
of life we'll all who are pro-life in congress looked up to him
mr speaker my heart breaks when i think about the children who are now a part of
the missing generation degeneration whose contributions to society we will
never will be no
generation whose lives could have inspired their families nation and world
had they been allowed to live
our society now discriminates against these chinese human beings who should
receive the same protections as other persons
not only does abortion stripped the world of human lives it also
dramatically affects the lives of mothers
leading them to deal with the emotional aftermath of this brutal procedure
i commend the work of pregnancy care centers across the country
that provide needed services to both mothers and their children

since roe versus wade
and pray that god continues to heal those touched by this tragic practice
i will remain steadfast in the fight for the rights and dignity of the unborn
every human deserves the opportunity to live and i will always fight to guard
the rights of the unborn i'm dedicated to protecting the sanctity of human life
from the unborn to the elderly
like a majority of the house today i made good on a campaign promise and
voted to repeal the job destroying healthcare law known as obama care
there are many reasons for my vote to repeal but one of my main reasons was
that the bill did not adequately protect life
you will recall president obama signed well-intended but ineffective executive

under obama care
we need that commitment written into law that is what i will fight for
tomorrow the house will vote on a resolution directing the appropriate

patients entered common-sense reforms
like many americans i want to see health care reform
that among other things include statutory language pro hitting taxpayer

providers
during my time in congress i have talked sponsored co-sponsored or supported many

one such bill i support unless congress is a chart two two seven
the sanctity of human life act
which declares that the right-to-life guaranteed by the constitution is

and that life begins at conception
i became an original co-sponsor of similar legislation h_r_ two one two

additionally either member of the values action team in the pro-life caucus
do these groups i work with my pro-life
pro-life colleagues in congress to advance legislation and initiatives that

one day in the future and i don't know how soon or how long it may take
i believe with all my heart that this country will have a renewal of respect

thank you mr speaker
